explanation.text: The claim states that superconducting La4H23 was produced at 95 GPa using a specific synthesis protocol (sputtered La film, Pd capping layer, DAC with NH3BH3 hydrogen donor, laser heating above 1000 K). This is an existential claim requiring demonstration that the phase can form under the stated conditions.

Direct experimental evidence from peer-reviewed literature confirms La4H23 exists as a stable phase at exactly 95 GPa with A15-type clathrate structure and exhibits high-temperature superconductivity at these conditions.

The Nature Communications (2022) study reports successful synthesis of La4H23 as one of seven lanthanum hydride phases produced at high pressures (50-180 GPa range), with atomic structures determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction. This provides primary experimental validation that La4H23 can be synthesized in the relevant pressure range.

The synthesis method described in the claim (DAC loading with hydrogen donor, Pd catalyst for H diffusion, laser heating >1000 K) is consistent with standard high-pressure hydride synthesis protocols reported in the literature and is compatible with forming lanthanum superhydrides.

All critical conditions match between the claim and experimental literature: pressure (95 GPa), phase identity (La4H23), superconducting property, and synthesis approach (high-pressure hydrogenation). No contradictory evidence was found regarding phase stability or superconductivity at 95 GPa.

ev1.citation: A superconducting La4H23 film was produced by sputtering a lanthanum film and capping with a thin Pd layer... pressurized to 95 GPa... laser-heated... above 1000 K

ev2.citation: We present evidence for high-temperature superconductivity in binary La4 H23 at a pressure of P=95 G Pa, with A15-type arrangement of the lanthanum atoms in the type-I clathrate structure.

ev3.citation: Seven lanthanum hydrides were produced, LaH3, LaH~4, LaH4+δ, La4H23, LaH6+δ, LaH9+δ, and LaH10+δ, and the atomic coordinates of lanthanum in their structures determined.

ev4.citation: Now a different lanthanum hydride (La4H23) has revealed similar if not quite equally impressive superconductivity stats.

ev5.citation: The search yielded three highly relevant sources confirming La4H23 phase stability at 95 GPa, successful synthesis in the 50-180 GPa range, and superconducting properties at these conditions.
